title: Homage to a Hero
provenance:
Paignon-Dijonval; sale, Paris, 1810, no. 4005; Double; Leon Decloux (acquired by him after 1906)
From the Double collection
Ex-Paignon-Dijouval collection (sold Paris, 1810 no. 4005)
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, watercolors, white gouache, graphite on cream paper, lined and framed with paper stripe representing molding
description: A large loggia shown from an oblique angle.  A large arch opens up into the outdoors.  A fountain and other buildings are visible just beyond the arch.  The interior of the loggia includes two large apses with half domes.  The walls are lined with fluted columns and pilasters.  Inside, at left, is a scene in which a hero in classical attire receives a wreath from Fortune and another gift from Architecture who is flanked by Painting and Sculpture in the apse at left.  Attributes of Music, Science, Justice, Commerce, Seafaring, and three putti are shown before the apse.  Fortune is accompanied on her clouds by putti; two carry a medallion with the monogram V S, and by Fame.  Apollo and the Muses are represented in the courts of the apse.
